contentrichtext.text: __NOTOC__ {{Infobox Company | name = Quest Aircraft | logo = [[File:QuestAircraftLogo.png]] | type = | genre = | foundation = | founder = | location_city = [[Sandpoint, Idaho]] | location_country = [[United States]] | location = | locations = | area_served = | key_people = CEO: Ron Wright | industry = [[Aerospace]] | products = [[General aviation]] aircraft | services = | market cap = | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | assets = | equity = | owner = | num_employees = 155 (August 2010) | parent = | divisions = | subsid = | homepage = [http://www.questaircraft.com www.questaircraft.com] | footnotes = | intl = }} [[File:Quest Kodiak 100 20090216.jpg|thumb|right|[[Quest Kodiak]]]] '''Quest Aircraft Company''' is an American aircraft manufacturing company located in [[Sandpoint, Idaho]]. Quest was started in 2001 to design and provide aircraft suitable for domestic and international humanitarian applications. ==History== Paul Schaller became CEO of the company in 2004, and by 2009 the employment force was 340 persons.<ref>{{cite web |last=Namowitz |first=Dan |url=http://www.aopa.org/aircraft/articles/2011/110610quest_aircraft_ceo_to_depart_other_changes_announced.html |title=Quest Aircraft CEO to Depart; Other Changes Announced |publisher=Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association |work=AOPA - Aircraft Owners and Pilots Association |date=2011-06-10 |accessdate=2012-10-15}}</ref> Following a soft economy, in 2010 the workforce was reduced down to 155 employees, but 2011 saw a fresh infusion of capital and a change in executive leadership as Schaller migrated to a consulting role in the company.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aero-news.net/index.cfm?do=main.textpost&id=b57190da-ac4f-4ab1-b867-966e1f9d8866 |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |title=Changes: Quest Aircraft Shifts Management, Shows Progress |work=Aero-News Network |date=2011-06-12 |accessdate=2012-10-15}}</ref> ==Products== * [[Quest Kodiak]] - a ten seat [[STOL]] utility aircraft equipped with a [[Pratt & Whitney Canada PT6|Pratt & Whitney Canada PT6-34]] turbine engine of {{convert|750|hp|kW|0|abbr=on}}. It received its Type Certificate on May 30, 2007 and its Production Certificate on September 15, 2009. ==See also== * [[List of companies based in Idaho]] ==References== {{reflist}} * Marsh, Alton K. ''AOPA Pilot'' 2006 ==External links== * [http://www.questaircraft.com Quest Aircraft Home Page] * [http://www.jetcam.com/studies/us_quest.htm CAM Case Study of Quest Kodiak] {{Aviation lists}} [[Category:Aircraft manufacturers of the United States]] [[Category:Companies based in Idaho]] [[Category:2004 establishments in Idaho]]
